meanings.definition: A device used to cover a horse's eyes to prevent distraction.
meanings.sent1: The horse wore a blinder during the race.
meanings.sent2: The blinder helped the horse focus on running.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous horse tried to peek around the blinder.
meanings.sent4: The blinder turned the horse's world into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The blinder shielded the horse's eyes from distractions.

meanings.definition: A very impressive or skillful performance.
meanings.sent1: Her singing was a blinder at the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The magician's blinder left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: The blinder of a dance routine made everyone cheer.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a blinder, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The blinder of a painting amazed all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A solid hit in sports, especially in cricket or rugby.
meanings.sent1: The cricket player delivered a blinder of a shot.
meanings.sent2: The rugby team celebrated after a blinder of a tackle.
meanings.sent3: The blinder of a kick scored the winning point.
meanings.sent4: The blinder of a swing sent the ball flying far.
meanings.sent5: The blinder of a move caught the opponent off guard.
